sources.title: Slightly Scarlet (1956) John Payne, Rhonda Fleming, Arlene Dahl, Ted De Corsia
sources.description: Slightly Scarlet is a 1956 American crime film, with some noirish elements, based on James M. Cain's novel Love's Lovely Counterfeit. It was directed by Allan Dwan, and its widescreen cinematography was by John Alton. The film stars John Payne, Rhonda Fleming, Arlene Dahl and Ted de Corsia.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia .

metadata.Plot: Kleptomaniac Dorothy Lyons is paroled from prison in custody of her sister June, secretary to "reform" political candidate Frank Jansen. Ben Grace, associate of crime boss Sol Caspar, sees this as a way to smear Jansen's campaign. But after falling out with Caspar, Ben tries to help June, who he begins to fall for. Sexy Dorothy also has a yen for Ben. June is reluctantly forced to go along with Ben's schemes, but there may be more to these than meets the eye...
